This contents of Bolzano’s theorem may be formulated more precisely as
the

If a real function $f$ is continuous on a closed interval $I$ and the
values of $f$ in the end points of $I$ have signs, then there exists a
zero of this function inside the interval.

The theorem is used when using the interval halving method for getting
an approximate value of a root of an equation of the form $f(x) = 0$.
